result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Standard Conditions *To be mailed to deft in custody at Oshkosh CI (1730 W. Snell Road)*
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Have no contact with female/male juveniles

3:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Joan M. Korb appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jose Juan Hernandez appeared by phone, in custody at Oshkosh CI. 
Deft advised of rights, rcvd criminal complaint/reading waived.
Charges and penalties read by the Court. 
NG plea entered. Bond set & to be mailed to Oshkosh CI for signature.
